headline: Altria Returns $4 Billion to Shareholders in First Half of 2025
summary: MO has returned more than $4 billion to its shareholders in early 2025, fueled by strong dividends, buybacks and a solid balance sheet.

headline: Trump’s Surgeon General Nominee to Divest Family Tobacco, Tech Holdings
summary: Now Means, a Stanford University-trained physician and wellness influencer who focuses on functional medicine, is disclosing “steps that I will take to avoid any actual or apparent conflict of interest.”  In an ethics agreement posted Sept. 13, she said she would divest family holdings that include shares in technology companies and Philip Morris International Inc. and Altria Group Inc., two of the world’s largest tobacco companies.  The other companies include Baidu Inc., a leading Chinese technology company, and Chevron Corp.
